snippet: As the presidential campaign focuses increasingly on President Obama's performance as commander in chief, a new study finds that he benefits from endorsements of retired military officers more than Mitt Romney does, particularly with coveted...
abstract: As the presidential campaign focuses increasingly on President Obama's performance as commander in chief, a new study finds that he benefits from endorsements of retired military officers more than Mitt Romney does, particularly with coveted independent voters.

headline.main: Military Endorsements Hold Greater Benefits for Democrats, Study Finds
